meanings.definition: The state of being stranded or left in a difficult situation without help or resources.
meanings.sent1: The strandedness of the shipwreck survivors was evident as they waited for rescue.
meanings.sent2: The strandedness of the hikers became apparent when they lost their way in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The strandedness of the cat on top of the tree led to a comical rescue mission by the firefighters.
meanings.sent4: The strandedness of the car in the middle of the desert was like a lone island in a sea of sand.
meanings.sent5: The strandedness of the astronaut in space highlighted the isolation and vulnerability of their situation.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being stranded or stuck in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the beach was overshadowed by the strandedness of the abandoned boat on the shore.
meanings.sent2: The strandedness of the old house on the hill gave it an eerie and desolate feel.
meanings.sent3: The strandedness of the lost kite on the power line amused the children in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The strandedness of the lone tree in the vast field made it a striking focal point.
meanings.sent5: The strandedness of the broken swing in the playground made it a symbol of neglect and abandonment.
